channel.title: Array on The Indian Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in Array on The Indian Engineer

item.title: Problem 1684 Count the Number of Consistent Strings
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1684 Question You are given a string allowed consisting of distinct characters and an array of strings words.

item.title: Problem 2326 Spiral Matrix IV
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2326 Question You are given two integers m and n, which represent the dimensions of a matrix.

item.title: Problem 2022 Convert 1D Array to 2D Array
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2022 Question You are given a 0-indexed 1-dimensional (1D) integer array original, and two integers, m and n.

item.title: Problem 54 Sprial Matrix
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 54 Question Given an m x n matrix, return all elements of the matrix in spiral order.

item.title: Problem 624 Maximum Distance in Arrays
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 624 Question You are given m arrays, where each array is sorted in ascending order.

item.title: Problem 860 Lemonade Change
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 860 Question At a lemonade stand, each lemonade costs $5.

item.title: Problem 40 Combination Sum II
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 40 Question Given a collection of candidate numbers (candidates) and a target number (target), find all unique combinations in candidates where the candidate numbers sum to target.

item.title: Problem 832 Flipping an Image
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 832 Question Given an n x n binary matrix image, flip the image horizontally, then invert it, and return the resulting image.

item.title: Problem 2751 Robot Collisions
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2751 Question There are n 1-indexed robots, each having a position on a line, health, and movement direction.

item.title: Problem 1701 Average Waiting Time
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1701 Question There is a restaurant with a single chef.

item.title: Problem 1550 Three Consecutive Odds
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1550 Question Given an integer array arr, return true if there are three consecutive odd numbers in the array.

item.title: Problem 1552 Magnetic Force Between Two Balls
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1552 Question In the universe Earth C-137, Rick discovered a special form of magnetic force between two balls if they are put in his new invented basket.

item.title: Problem 1482 Minimum Number of Days to Make M Bouquets
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1482 Question You are given an integer array bloomDay, an integer m and an integer k.

item.title: Problem 502 IPO
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 502 Question Suppose LeetCode will start its IPO soon.

item.title: Problem 945 Minimum Increment to Make Array Unique
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 945 Question You are given an integer array nums.

item.title: Problem 2037 Minimum Number of Moves to Seat Everyone
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2037 Question There are n seats and n students in a room.

item.title: Problem 75 Sort Colors
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 75 Question Given an array nums with n objects colored red, white, or blue, sort them in-place so that objects of the same color are adjacent, with the colors in the order red, white, and blue.

item.title: Problem 1002 Find Common Characters
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1002 Question Given a string array words, return an array of all characters that show up in all strings within the words (including duplicates).

item.title: Problem 786 K th Smallest Prime Fraction
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 786 Question You are given a sorted integer array arr containing 1 and prime numbers, where all the integers of arr are unique.

item.title: Problem 200 Number of Islands
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 200 Question Given an m x n 2D binary grid grid which represents a map of '1's (land) and '0's (water), return the number of islands.

item.title: Problem 463 Island Perimeter
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 463 Question You are given row x col grid representing a map where grid[i][j] = 1 represents land and grid[i][j] = 0 represents water.
